error.signature: OperationalError: (2003, 'Can't connect to MySQL server on rds-host (timed out)')
error.regex: (Can't connect to.*server on.*timed out|Connection timed out.*rds)

verdict.summary: Cannot connect to RDS instance — usually a security group or network configuration issue.

dead_ends.action: Making the RDS instance publicly accessible
dead_ends.why_fails: Security risk; database exposed to the internet

dead_ends.action: Opening all ports in the security group (0.0.0.0/0)
dead_ends.why_fails: Exposes all services; major security vulnerability

workarounds.action: Check security group inbound rules: allow port 3306 (MySQL) or 5432 (PostgreSQL) from your IP/VPC
workarounds.how: Security group must allow the database port from the client's IP or security group

workarounds.action: Verify the instance is in a reachable subnet — check VPC routing tables and NAT gateway
workarounds.how: Private subnets need NAT gateway for outbound; clients need a route to the RDS subnet

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'OperationalError' indicates a network or operation timeout, while 'An error occurred (AccessDenied) when calling the AssumeRole operation' indicates missing Docker registry authentication.
